categories: Category:Articles with an excess of redlinks

nodes.text: Star Wars Komiks (Star Wars Comic in Polish) is a Polish comic magazine published by Egmont Polska. It was preceeded by Gwiezdne wojny Komiks, which was published from 1999 to 2000. The first issue was released on 16th September 2008. Originally the magazine was published monthly, but since April 2012 the schedule was changed to bimonthly. The first run ended with 58th issue which was released in August 2014.

Most issues of the original run contained 48 pages although several issues contained 64. The magazine featured 2-4 graphic novels, either Star Wars Tales stories, one-shots or short story arcs from Republic, Empire, X-Wing Rogue Squadron and Rebellion series, as well as ocasional articles about a specific Star Wars topic. Two spin-off magazines were launched during the first run, Star Wars Komiks - wydanie specjalne (Star Wars Comic - special edition) in 2009 and Star Wars Komiks Extra in 2010. Both contained more pages than the base run, 96 and 144 respectively, and featured longer, four or six issue series or story arcs.

The magazine was relaunched in September 2015 in a new format and focusing on canon stories. Most issues are quivalent to Marvel Comics trade paperbacks with the exception of Star Wars: Shattered Empire, which was divided between two issues containing shorter stories. The new run features both shorter series like Lando and Princess Leia and ongoing series like Star Wars, Darth Vader and Poe Dameron.
